properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazards: - hail near 2 cm in size - heavy rain near 50 mm in one hour - wind gusts near 90 km/h This severe thunderstorm is located from Clarence to Beauchampville, moving south at 20 km/h. Locations impacted include: Rockland, Clarence, Becketts Creek, Vinette, Clarence-Rockland, Rockland East, Clarence Creek, Orient and St-Pascal. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazards: - wind gusts near 90 km/h - hail near 2 cm in size Timing: - this evening ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain until this evening. Boaters may be caught off guard by strong gusts on smaller bodies of water. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T04:09:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T20:45:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3370664611.2020

properties.Title: Tornado Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:22 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm that is possibly producing a tornado. Damaging winds, large hail and locally intense rainfall are also possible. Doppler radar continues to indicate rotation on a thunderstorm 10 km northeast of Rapid City. This thunderstorm is moving northeast at 30 km/h. ### This is a dangerous and potentially life-threatening situation. Tornado warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-06-28T22:14:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T21:23:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0794064465.2020
Area: R.M. of Oakview incl. Oak River and Rapid City, R.M. of Minto-Odanah incl. Minnedosa and Moore Park

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and heavy rain. Thunderstorms to develop and/or move into northwest New Brunswick beginning early this afternoon. The largest threat is for strong wind gusts, and local intense showers. A line of thunderstorm approaching from the west are slowly moving into Edmundston County as of 6:00 pm ADT. The main threat is for heavy rainfall amounts and possibly strong and gusty winds. The line will continue to move into northwest New Brunswick, but impacts should diminish this evening. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-28T23:59:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T21:06:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0864904212.2020
Area: Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 38 are expected. A prolonged period of hot weather continues over portions of southern and east-central Manitoba. Southerly winds are spreading hot and humid weather into Manitoba. Over the coming days, daytime highs will climb into the low thirties with overnight lows staying in the upper teens or low twenties. Humidex values will be in the upper thirties/low forties. The heat will begin to break through the latter half of the week. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T13:51:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T21:52:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4114189614.2020
Area: Oxford House and Gods Lake, Red Sucker Lake, Island Lake

properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:41 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, toonie to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. A southwest to northeast oriented line of thunderstorms from Deloraine to north of Brandon is traveling northeast at 40 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and torrential rain. Potential rainfall rates: 25 mm per hour or higher in thunderstorms. Potential wind gusts: 90 km/h or more in thunderstorms. Locations: Central Newfoundland. Time span: early this evening. Remarks: The greatest risk for severe thunderstorms will be over interior areas. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-06-29T01:59:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-28T20:59:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2979780653.2020
Area: Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:04 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to golf ball size hail and flooding rain. A line of thunderstorms stretches from the international border south of Waskada to just north of Dauphin, traveling northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-29T00:39:44-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Humidex values reaching 38 are expected. A prolonged period of hot weather continues over portions of southern and east-central Manitoba. Southerly winds are spreading hot and humid weather into Manitoba. Over the coming days, daytime highs will climb into the low thirties with overnight lows staying in the upper teens or low twenties. Humidex values will be in the upper thirties/low forties. The heat will begin to break through the latter half of the week. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. For more information on heat and your health: - Visit Manitoba Health at: http://www.manitoba.ca/health/publichealth/environmentalhealth/heat.html. - Call Health Links – Info Santé at 204-788-8200 or toll-free at 1-888-315-9257. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-29T13:51:40-00:00
